title: 1950's t lettering
content:
Hiya folks

Would anyone be able to give me an ID on the font on this vintage t please?  
Think it's a fairly common one for that time period.

Many thanks in advance

Steve

Font: 

 Franklin Gothic Extra Condensed 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155202/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155202/http:/typophile.com/files/image_77.jpg) | 45.14 KB |
author: Kilgore Trout 23

comments.content: It looks like **[Franklin Gothic Extra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317155202/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Elsner%2BFlake&ffam=FranklinGothicEF%20ExtraCondens%20-%20Regular&fid=d1ea5ce46924c7b2e38e22300de0e506&fsize=60&text=CINCINNATI%20REDLEGS&fit=1)** by Morris Fuller Benton, available from various foundries (Adobe, URW++, Linotype, etc)

Wow that was fast!

It certainly does...that's great, thank you so much!

Very best wishes

Steve
